title: why geth always crashes?
body:
My production environment node crashed several times during this time, I don't know what caused it. I guess it may be caused by insufficient memory.  

The usual 40% memory usage suddenly spikes to 90% and the node crashes. It has happened more than once.

- CentOS 7
- geth:   v1.9.12-stable
- RAM:   8G 
- disk :   756G  SSD

geth  crash  log   ( contains restart log  due to the geth  auto be  restarted  by a script )  


@holiman Wasn't there an OOM bug in 1.9.9 we fixed later? That took out bootnodes offline? Can't remember exactly.

I don't recall that... However, this looks a bit odd to me: 
```
INFO [03-24|20:16:07.422] Bumping default cache on mainnet         provided=1024 updated=4096
WARN [03-24|20:16:07.423] Sanitizing cache to Go's GC limits       provided=4096 updated=2607
```
So apparently we find `mem.Total` to be `7821 M`, set the cache to `2.6G` and let leveldb get half of that: `cache=1.27GiB`. It _seems_ sane. 

Anyway, we've done three releases since `1.9.9`, so I guess the first thing to try should be to use the latest (right now `1.9.12`)

@holiman   Thanks !   

I wrote the wrong version.

I have just checked the geth version of my production environment, it is indeed `v1.9.9`. (my dev geth is `v1.9.12` .... )

I have replaced it with `v1.9.12` version just now. Hope that there will be no more crashes.
I think latest version is much better now since I upgraded
@youngqqcn almost a month passed, I assume it's working well with the more recent version. If the problem persists, please open a new issue.
